item.title: The calling of Ttuai-an's name
item.summary: Explanation of various personal names was given, in the Katkop dialect, by Díä!kwãin (L V.-10. 4751-4754, 4758-4777, 18. 5373 rev., 19. 5505 rev. and 5506 rev., 20. 5572 and 5573, 5605-5607). Also, by /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-1. 6092 and 6093, 28. 8470). |han≠kass'o's step-grandmother (Ttuai-an) was named after the ssuen ssuen (from 'Bushman rice') that the people collected, picking them off the ground to eat.
item.comments: 1) p.8469v: Ttuai-an's name and 'Bushman Rice's ssuen-ssuen', 2) This story is found in Book VIII-28
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)

keyword.subkw: accounting for the giving of Ttuai-an's
why his step-grandmother, Ttuai-an, was given her name
